title: Ticket #3760: Windows - Mv contents of a folder to top of sandbox broken
description:
We document adding a / after a folder name will move the contents of a folder to the top of the sandbox.

Without a slash or with a reverse slash (\) and an extra line, the folder moves over intact. Adding what works on Linux (/) generates the hold reason. This is the only change from the directory moving over intact. 

  executable = ls.pl
  output = ls.out
  error = ls.err
  log = ls.log
  transfer_input_files = testfolder/
  should_transfer_files = YES
  when_to_transfer_output = ON_EXIT
  queue

ls.pl 

  #!/usr/bin/env perl


  system("dir");
  system("dir testfolder");

HoldReason = "Error from slot1@btthinkpad: SHADOW at 128.105.136.28 failed to send file(s) to <128.105.136.28:54774>: error reading from C:\condor\testfolder/: (errno 13) Permission denied; STARTER failed to receive file(s) from <128.105.136.28:54764>"
